section.title: Creating a new logical network in a data center or cluster
section.para: You can add new logical networks to clusters and data centers. Add a logical network to a data center and it becomes available to all clusters in the data center. Add a logical network to a cluster and it can be used by hosts in that cluster only. You can use logical networks to segregate network traffic.

step.para: Select either the Data Centers or the Clusters tab.
Select the cluster or data center you'd like to add a new logical network to.
Select the Logical Networks tab from the cluster's or data center's details pane.
If you're working with a data center, click the New button. If you're working with a cluster, click the Add Network button.The New Logical Network dialog is displayed.

Enter the configuration details of your new logical network. Adding a logical network to a data center requires all the same configuration entries as adding a logical network to a cluster, and additionally allows you to add the network to any or all clusters in the data center.

formalpara.title: Result
formalpara.para: Your new logical network is listed in the Logical Networks tab of details pane of the data center or cluster you added it to. You can now associate that logical network with network interfaces on hosts in clusters that use the logical network.
